decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence through efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher, while also utilizing burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game, using cards like Palace Sentinels to generate card advantage and Prismatic Strands to protect against opposing threats. The addition of cards like Journey to Nowhere and Electrickery provide removal options to clear the way for attacks.

This deck is centered around utilizing cheap, efficient creatures like Augur of Bolas, Kiln Fiend, and Nivix Cyclops to quickly apply pressure and overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes a variety of cantrips and cheap spells to dig for more threats and protect its creatures from removal. The goal is to quickly build a board presence and finish off the opponent with powerful pump spells like Temur Battle Rage. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent casting of threats and spells.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent through efficient creatures like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher, backed up by powerful removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast. The deck aims to maintain card advantage with cards like Thraben Inspector and Palace Sentinels, while utilizing artifact mana sources like Alchemist's Vial and Prophetic Prism to fix mana and ensure consistency. Additional cards like Journey to Nowhere provide removal options, while cards like Battle Screech offer a way to go wide and overwhelm the opponent.

The deck focuses on efficiently deploying low-cost creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours while disrupting the opponent with cards like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell. The deck aims to apply pressure early on while maintaining control of the board using counter spells and bounce effects. The Mutagenic Growth and Snap cards offer additional versatility in combat and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying creatures to the battlefield to apply pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells. The inclusion of Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for card advantage by returning creatures to hand, while also maximizing damage output with evasive threats like Delver of Secrets. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to both blue and red mana sources. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early board presence and maintain control of the game through a mix of aggression and disruption.

This aggressive Pauper deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal spells. By efficiently filling the graveyard with cards like Mental Note and Thought Scour, the deck can easily delve out big threats and maintain card advantage. The deck's versatility in both aggression and control allows it to adapt to various matchups and outmaneuver opponents with a combination of tempo plays and powerful creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures while using efficient low-cost spells to enhance their abilities. The key strategy is to build a strong board presence quickly and maintain momentum through the use of pump spells and evasion abilities. By maximizing the value of each creature and leveraging the synergy between cards, this Mono Green Aggro deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a swift victory.

This deck focuses on maintaining board control and tempo with cheap evasive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Ninja of the Deep Hours, supported by countermagic and removal spells like Spellstutter Sprite and Skred. The deck aims to generate card advantage through Ponder and Preordain, while also having access to reach with Lightning Bolt. The mana base is designed to support the snow-covered lands synergy for Skred and also includes some cantrips to ensure consistent mana and card flow.

The main idea of this deck is to combine the speed and aggression of an Aggro deck with the control and flexibility of a Midrange deck. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Augur of Bolas and Delver of Secrets, along with disruptive spells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell, the deck can apply early pressure and maintain board control. Ninja of the Deep Hours provides card advantage, while cards like Skred and Lightning Bolt offer removal options. This deck aims to maintain tempo and adapt to different matchups, ultimately overwhelming opponents with a well-balanced strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with low-cost artifacts, taking advantage of the affinity mechanic to reduce their cost. By playing multiple artifacts each turn, the goal is to power up cards like Atog and Carapace Forger to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Additionally, the deck includes some burn spells like Galvanic Blast to finish off the opponent or clear the way for attackers. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging the synergy between artifacts, this deck aims to outpace and outmuscle the opponent in a Pauper 1 vs 1 match.

The deck focuses on aggressively playing creatures with disruptive abilities and then protecting them with counterspells and bounce spells. By leveraging cheap cantrips for card advantage and tempo plays, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Augur of Bolas and Spellstutter Sprite provide additional value and interaction, enhancing the deck's ability to control the board while dealing damage. The Mono Blue color identity ensures consistency in mana production and deployment of threats, enabling the deck to consistently outpace the opponent in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 Pauper format.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant, while also utilizing cards like Ninja of the Deep Hours and Spellstutter Sprite for tempo advantage. Ponder and Preordain are used for card selection and digging through the deck quickly. Counterspell and Envelop provide protection against spells, while Lightning Bolt and Skred offer removal options. The mana base is optimized with Ash Barrens and Snow-Covered lands. The overall strategy is to apply pressure early with aggressive creatures and maintain control of the game with efficient card choices and removal spells.

The main concept of this deck is to take advantage of the Affinity mechanic by playing cheap artifact creatures and using cards like Thoughtcast to draw more cards. The deck aims to quickly get big threats on the board such as Atog and Myr Enforcer, while using cards like Fling and Galvanic Blast for direct damage. The deck also includes ways to protect its creatures with cards like Metallic Rebuke and Flayer Husk. Overall, this deck focuses on playing aggressively and overwhelming the opponent with a fast and powerful board presence.

This deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board early on with cheap and efficient removal spells while applying pressure with evasive threats like Delver of Secrets and Gurmag Angler. The deck also takes advantage of disruption spells like Spellstutter Sprite and Counterspell to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently using cantrips like Ponder and Brainstorm to dig for key cards, the deck aims to quickly close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to control the game by deploying powerful threats ahead of schedule. It utilizes Tron lands to generate large amounts of mana efficiently, allowing it to cast high-cost creatures such as Ulamog's Crusher and Wretched Gryff early on. In addition, it includes cards like Crop Rotation and Expedition Map to ensure that the Urzatron lands are assembled quickly. The deck also includes some card draw and recursion options to maintain card advantage and resilience in the late game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing the Urzatron lands to produce large amounts of mana. It aims to stall the game with removal spells like Flame Slash and Doom Blade, while drawing cards with Mulldrifter and Sea Gate Oracle. The deck also includes recursion with Mnemonic Wall and Ghostly Flicker to generate value. It has access to various counterspells like Condescend and Prohibit to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to generate a lot of mana, the deck can finish off the opponent with Rolling Thunder or Capsize.

The main concept of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. The deck focuses on playing efficient creatures like Chittering Rats, Gray Merchant of Asphodel, and Gurmag Angler, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with removal spells like Geth's Verdict and Victim of Night. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through Phyrexian Rager and Sign in Blood, while also providing a way to gain life with cards like Corrupt and Tendrils of Corruption. The deck is well-rounded and aims to close out games quickly with its aggressive creatures and removal spells.

The deck focuses on playing cheap and efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant to establish early board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. It also utilizes card draw and counter spells to maintain control of the game. The inclusion of Ninja of the Deep Hours allows for additional card advantage while Skred and Lightning Bolt provide removal and help to clear the opponent's board. The mana base is built around snow-covered lands to support Skred and make it an efficient removal spell.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through the use of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to assemble Urzatron lands to generate a large amount of mana to cast powerful spells like Rolling Thunder. It includes cards like Mnemonic Wall and Mystical Teachings to recycle key spells and maintain card advantage. The deck also includes ways to stay alive and stall the game with Moment's Peace and Wail of the Nim. The synergy between the cards allows the player to outlast opponents and secure victory through incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on using small, efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Faerie Miscreant to apply early pressure on the opponent. Augur of Bolas and Ninja of the Deep Hours provide card advantage while Spellstutter Sprite helps to counter opponent's spells. The deck also includes removal in the form of Lightning Bolt and Skred. The mana base is built around Snow-Covered Islands and Mountains to support Skred and Gush. Overall, the deck aims to control the board early on and transition into a more midrange strategy with the Ninja of the Deep Hours.
